places.generalDescription: Liverpool Cathedral, also known as the Anglican Liverpool Cathedral, is a grand 20th-century place of worship that boasts the world's highest Gothic arches and a towering viewing tower. Despite its ancient appearance, it was actually completed in 1978 after 74 years of construction. Designed by Sir Giles Gilbert Scott, this masterpiece of Gothic Revival is Britain's largest cathedral and features contemporary visual art installations that add to its unique atmosphere.

reviews.text: Absolutely beautiful building.  Accessible with 1 transit wheelchair available to use. Plenty of parking including blue badge although charges apply. Choir and organ sounded amazing and we could join in the service if we wanted to. Gorgeous architecture,  stained glass windows etc. Very helpful staff. The people of Liverpool are very welcoming. ❤️

Wow such an impressive building inside as well as out! Large car park at good rates, the cafe is a bistro so bit posh for me but cuppa, baguette then scone and cream was okay. Other tables had the roast which looked yummy. So much to see and notice, easy to spend a few hours walking round. The volunteers\staff are really friendly and knowledgeable, relying on donations. I bought a ticket for the tower in the shop. £7 was great value and it didn't seem like 108 steps as two lifts take you a long way up, and walking up looking down at the still bells makes you think! (I'm from Leeds so I haven't heard them) Staff member up the tower today was great, pointing buildings, areas, answering questions. Such a beautiful day, you can see for miles! Going back the opposite way down, lifts again to the cathedral. Really is worth the climb if you are able...

Liverpool Cathedral is an excellent display of architectural brilliance. It's soaring steeple ,which contributes to the Liverpool skyline, offers tours and brilliant views of the city. The church is free to enter, but to go to the top of the steeple is not. The shear scale of the cathedral is truly breathtaking featuring intricate and skilled designs. The interior of the building is equally as beautiful, with its large stain glass windows and carved stone arches. Of these arches, there is the ingenious whispering arch where the curvature of the archway allows for whispers to travel to the other side of the room. Finally, the church features a large gift shop and free toilets alongside its brilliant religious facilities. Overall, the church is definitely worth a visit if you are in the area.

places.generalDescription: Royal Albert Dock Liverpool is a vibrant waterfront area that has undergone a stunning renovation, shedding its industrial past to become one of Liverpool's most popular tourist attractions. It features a mix of museums, art galleries, family-friendly restaurants, and shops. The dock boasts the largest collection of Grade-listed buildings in the UK and offers picturesque waterfront views. Visitors can explore gift shops, cafes, and restaurants while enjoying pop-up food courts and love locks overlooking the Mersey.

sources.snippet: There are few cities in the UK that can match the prestige on a number of levels that Liverpool can offer, from its historic locations such as the Royal Albert Dock to its cultural landmarks, which include the origins of perhaps the most famous pop music act of all times, the Beatles. Due in part to its large Irish diaspora community, Liverpool is a city with a rich heritage that makes up a melting pot you’ll see reflected in its streets, shops and bars. It’s a city where sport matters - home to two prominent football clubs - and also where art pervades every lane, as you will see in the city’s many galleries.

places.name: Museum of Liverpool

reviews.text:
Much like the museum itself, I could write an extensive review here that covers many, many areas of Liverpool's history and culture but it would simply take too long and you probably only want to know if this museum is worth your time. It is.

This is an astoundingly good museum. There's so much here to see you should set aside a few hours and enjoy. Everything is so well curated, the building and staff are wonderful.

We absolutely need to return to take in more information.

The Museum of Liverpool may not immediately dazzle with flashy theatrics, but for anyone fascinated by history, it's a real treasure trove. As the first national museum devoted to the story of a regional city, its purpose-built building on Pier Head presents Liverpool's past in a smart, contemporary setting.

Inside, the museum is organized into four major thematic galleries: The Great Port, Global City, People's Republic, and Wondrous Place. These cover everything from Liverpool's role in maritime trade and the empire, to its diverse communities, culture, migration, and urban development – spanning a timeline from prehistoric times to the present day. With over 6,000 objects on show, paired with interactive sections like History Detectives and the Little Liverpool play area for under‑6s, it's both educational and engaging.

For history-buffs, the highlight is definitely the well-curated storytelling of Liverpool's global influence, technological growth, and multicultural heritage. While it may lack the visual impact of larger museums, its depth and context are what make it stand out.

A particular gem is the top-floor sports gallery, featuring exhibits and archives on football and other local sporting traditions, alongside multimedia displays celebrating the city's sporting heritage . It's a fitting tribute to Liverpool's sporting culture and proves that even in a history museum, sports can play a starring role.

Overall impression

Not a flashy museum, but rich, thoughtfully curated, and highly rewarding for history enthusiasts.
Clean, modern building with a logical layout across three public floors.
The sports gallery on the top floor adds a dynamic touch and is well worth visiting.
Ideal for those who appreciate Liverpool's complex story-from maritime prowess to urban identity.
If you're drawn to the narrative behind the city-its people, international connections, and evolving social fabric-this museum delivers an insightful and memorable experience.

This is a truly unique museum, holding the distinction of being the world's first dedicated to the history of a regional city. Admission is free, and it's both informative and engaging, with the added bonus of a stunning, sweeping view of the River Mersey from one of its upper floors.
For anyone who enjoys learning about the story of a city and her people, this museum is a must-especially when it's a city as vibrant and special as Liverpool. One highlight for me was an exhibit featuring the different birds that once contended for the right to be associated with the city's name-I had a good laugh there.
My mum and I spent about two hours exploring, and still didn't manage to see everything. It's definitely the kind of place you can return to time and again, always leaving with something new learned.

places.name: The Beatles Story Museum, Liverpool

reviews.text:
This was one of my favorite stops in Liverpool! The museum was done very well with memorabilia documenting the bands rise to fame. There were a lot of built displays such as the yellow submarine, the magical mystery bus, and clubs like the Cavern. Each exhibit has a number to correspond with the audio guided tour. Headphones and a handset are provided with the cost of entry. You don't need to worry about your phone losing battery or signal to hear all of the facts along the way.
Signed memorabilia and Beatles merchandise is displayed throughout the museum. Original song lyrics written by the band and producers. Sgt Pepper and A Hard Days Night outfits are on display. Cartoon cells from The Yellow Submarine.
The audio guide was informative but a bit long winded at times. There is obviously Beatles music playing throughout the different exhibits to correspond with the display.
Each member of the band has a specific section dedicated to their lives. There are actual instruments played by the Beatles and items they have owned.
At the end, there is a recreation of John Lennon and Yoko Ono's white room. A pair of Lennon's round framed eyeglasses sit atop a pedestal in the middle. Many of his sketches are hung on the walls. Great gift shop at the end. They have a small cafe with ready made items. The area is full of many other things to do so pay for parking and explore. Lots of restaurants, a shopping mall, and multiple activities (carousel, light show, etc).
We went on a Friday afternoon. Museum was relatively quiet. No wait to enter.

The Beatles Story Museum was different than I  anticipated, but highly enjoyable!  We were greeted by kind and welcoming staff at the door and purchased tickets when we arrived.  The ticket includes the audio guide, which isn't just an enhancement, but a really essential part of the visit.  The audio guide tells the story of the Beatles as you move from room to room.  So it's a combination of recreations and memorabilia, organized in a way to walk you through their story.  I found it interesting and insightful.  We were there just over an hour, though your visit could be longer if you listened to every bonus video and feature on the audio guide.  Self-guided tour ends with a cafe and then a huge gift shop.  So glad we did this when visiting Liverpool.  It was different than anticipated, but in a good way!

Tucked into the iconic Albert Dock, The Beatles Story Museum is nothing short of a pilgrimage site for music lovers, dreamers, and die-hard Beatles fans. From the moment you step through its doors, you're whisked away on a nostalgic journey through the life, music, and legacy of the Fab Four.

The experience is masterfully immersive. Each exhibit feels like stepping into a time capsule-recreations of The Cavern Club, Abbey Road Studios, and even the psychedelic brilliance of Sgt. Pepper-era magic are all brought to life with authentic detail. The audio guide, narrated by those close to the band, adds depth and emotion, weaving personal anecdotes with historical insight.

It's more than a museum-it's a heartbeat of 60s culture, vibrating with Lennon's wit, McCartney's melodies, Harrison's soul, and Starr's rhythm. Rare memorabilia, original instruments, and poignant interviews paint a vivid portrait of four lads from Liverpool who changed the world.

The gift shop is a treasure trove for collectors, and the café offers the perfect spot to reflect while “Let It Be” plays softly in the background.

Whether you're a lifelong fan or a curious newcomer, The Beatles Story is a must-visit. It's heartfelt, informative, and genuinely magical-a love letter to the band that made the world sing!

places.generalDescription: Sefton Park is a sprawling Grade-listed park in Liverpool, covering 200 acres and offering a variety of natural beauty. It features a boating lake, playground, and a charming lakeside cafe. The park is famous for its iconic Victorian Palm House, which hosts various events. Throughout the year, the park hosts the Liverpool International Music Festival with free outdoor concerts featuring international artists and local talent. Additionally, it's known for inspiring the Beatles to create Sgt Pepper due to its bandstand.

sources.snippet: Sefton park almost always has a celebration that you can go to as a couple. You can enjoy some free music festivals, gut-busting comedy festivals or a delicious foodie event with local restaurants coming together to serve some of their most popular dishes. Although you will be surrounded by thousands of other festival goers, you’re sure to create memories that will last for years to come!.
sources.shortName: 13 Things To Do in Liverpool For Couples

sources.snippet: Going to Sefton Park is one of the most romantic things to do in Liverpool that involve nature. Sefton Park is a beautiful historic park that you can find in the south of the city. You can find here a lot of beautiful nature, including many trees that are gorgeous.
sources.shortName: 37 Romantic Things To Do in Liverpool: Date Ideas in Liverpool

places.name: Sefton Park

reviews.text: Sefton Park is a beautiful park to visit and explore.  It caters for everyone.  You have the beautiful palm house that hosts public and private events You have the lake to walk around.  In the summer the bandstand is used for musical entertainment events.  The park itself holds events of all kinds. There are lots of walking trails and paths.   Great place to have a picnic. It has tennis courts that you can rent out. There is a kids Play area and there are two cafes on site that you can purchase food, drinks and ice cream.  They both have toilet facilities.  There is lots of free street parking and a carpark.  Gets really busy in the Spring and Summer.  Best to go early morning or late evening to get a parking space.

It's a really nice park, huge with a very sizeable lake in the middle. The restored Victorian palm house truly is the gem of this park. Sadly there is still an air of run down and neglect here over the rest of the park. It would be worth spending the money and bring it back to it's true potential.

Beautiful place to visit in all seasons, but especially on a warm spring day. Open green and vast spaces, great walks, a lake, cafe, the Palm House with its own cafe and fee events, and the many statues, including Peter Pan. Not many cities can offer such amazing green spaces as Liverpool. A great place to visit.

places.address: Liverpool, L17, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Cowshed Liverpool offers a variety of beef dishes served with classic and innovative sides and drinks in a modern setting. The small but exceptional kitchen team provides personalized advice on the best way to cook each steak for optimal taste and tenderness. The restaurant's cozy ambiance, located within a converted townhouse, along with its homely decor, creates a romantic and rustic atmosphere. In addition to traditional cuts of steak, the menu features creative side dishes at reasonable prices.

sources.snippet: Cozy up in a booth and enjoy a traditional British meal, ranging from classics such as steak, to creative side dishes. Cowshed’s location, set within a converted townhouse, paired with homely decor, creates a romantic, rustic ambiance that’s hard to top. Dishes are hearty and comforting yet reasonably priced.
sources.shortName: 15 Fun Things To Do in Liverpool for Couples

sources.snippet: If you don’t like being told what to do, then Cowshed is probably not for you. The self-described beefhouse (as opposed to steakhouse) offers four types of steak, each served how they want to serve it, not how you ask them to serve it – “trust us”, they implore on the menu.
sources.shortName: 19 super-romantic restaurants for a Valentine's date in Liverpool

places.name: Cowshed Liverpool

reviews.text: We went for my birthday meal and the whole experience was amazing. The staff were very attentive and dealt with my allergy really well. The food was excellent we had the 3 greedy cows sharing platter, the sauces were all perfect, the sides were great and the steaks were phenomenal. We also ordered a roast cauliflower main too which was on par with the steaks. The cocktails were also very well balanced and tasted great. Overall a great place, would highly recommend.

If you're a serious steak lover in Liverpool, then Cowshed is an absolute must-visit. From the moment you step inside, you're greeted with a warm and inviting atmosphere, and the tantalizing aroma of perfectly cooked beef fills the air.
I recently had the pleasure of dining here, and it was an exceptional experience from start to finish. The menu is straightforward, focusing on high-quality cuts of beef cooked to perfection. I opted for the ribeye, and it was cooked exactly as I requested – beautifully seared on the outside with a succulent and tender pink center. The flavor was rich and beefy, exactly what you crave.
The sides were equally impressive. The chunky chips were crisp on the outside and fluffy inside, and the garlic mushrooms were bursting with flavor. They also offer a selection of delicious sauces to complement your steak.
Beyond the incredible food, the service was outstanding. Our server was attentive, friendly, and knowledgeable about the different cuts of meat and offered helpful recommendations. The staff clearly take pride in what they do, and it shows.
The ambiance is also worth noting. It's a contemporary space with a relaxed and unpretentious feel, making it perfect for a special occasion or a casual night out with friends.

Let's start by saying that the staff is amazing. Very quick and attentive. The starter of the tiger prawn was really good. The steak though were aggressively mediocre. The kind of steaks you would find at a regular pub and not up to the standards of a steakhouse. The crust was almost non-existent and the seasoning was poor. This is the time when we almost used up all of the provided sauce which is a sign that the steak itself is not great. I had higher hopes given the very high rating but now I am disappointed.

places.address: 104 Seel St, Liverpool, L1 4BL, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Nestled on Seel Street, Hot Water Comedy Club is Liverpool's sole purpose-built comedy venue. With shows every night of the week, it's a prime spot to catch emerging comedians and top-notch acts alike. The club also hosts events in The Wirral, Manchester, and at the Edinburgh Fringe Festival. Founded by two brothers as a weekly comedy night, it has since blossomed into an independent comedy hub in the vibrant Ropewalks area.

sources.snippet: There is no better way to break the ice on a first date than by visiting a great comedy club. There are many venues to choose from in Liverpool such as Laughterhouse Comedy and Comedy Central, but our pick is the Hot Water Comedy Club which is conveniently located on Seel Street.
sources.shortName: Romantic Places to Spend an Evening in Liverpool – CARO lets

sources.snippet: Choose from the Hot Water Comedy Club or Liverpool Comedy Central and prepare to giggle until your abs hurt!. Playing host to a huge range of comedians and stars, it’s the ideal destination for date night with a difference.
sources.shortName: 42 Romantic Things to Do This Valentine’s Day in Liverpool

places.name: Hot Water Comedy Club

reviews.text:
I Love this place.
Accessibility is spot on.
Plenty to eat and drink, lots of variety.
The large tree with lights is mesmerising.
We've been a few times now and currently planning our return.
Highly recommend.
In fact, I've told many people about it. 👍

Oh, and we met Paul Smith's dog Pablo❗️
🐾🐕‍🦺

Great intimate venue. But you are going to get super intimate with whatever person is sat next to you. The seats make airline economy seats look generous,  you're nearly sat in the lap of the people next to you. Sound quality and visibility of performance are top notch though.

Awesome place.
I only dropped a star because I have walking difficulties and was told I could order and have my drinks delivered in the auditorium, which is true but, there are no non-alcoholic or hot drink options from the menu.
Had I been able to drunk alcohol there were no options for spirits either.
I really would have loved to have given this place 5 stars because all the staff are awesome and the type of people this venue attracts. Everyone was so nice, friendly, welcoming, and polite.
The mass respect was so refreshing and made me feel safe.
I think I might even consider returning even if I were alone.

places.address: Hot Water Comedy Club at Blackstock Market, 15-17 Blackstock St, Liverpool L3 6ER, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: The Royal Liverpool Philharmonic is a historic concert venue that has been showcasing live classical and modern music, comedy, and cinema since the 1930s. With a seating capacity of 1790, it stands as a symbol of the city's rich arts, music, and culture scene. The original art deco style building holds Grade II listed status and offers visitors an elegant setting to enjoy performances.

sources.snippet: The main focus of the hall is concerts; the hall is the home of the Royal Liverpool Philharmonic Society, and numerous artists, such as Cliff Richard and Kraftwerk have also played here, in either the 1700-seater main hall or the smaller side rooms. The building itself, which is Grade II listed, is a triumph of architecture, so choosing to visit provides the chance to explore the stunning space and, of course, catch the concert of your choice with that special someone.
sources.shortName: 9 Best Romantic Things To Do In Liverpool, England

sources.snippet: The Liverpool Philharmonic Hall is a place everyone should visit at least once. The romantic venue is located on Hope Street in Liverpool’s Georgian quarter and is surrounded by amazing restaurants and bars.
sources.shortName: Romantic Places to Spend an Evening in Liverpool – CARO lets

sources.snippet: Listen, you absolutely can’t come to Liverpool and not treat your ears to a night at the Royal Liverpool Philharmonic. It’s like going to Paris and ignoring the Eiffel Tower – an absolute no-no!
sources.shortName: 10 Fun Things to Do in Liverpool for Couples in 2024

places.name: Royal Liverpool Philharmonic

reviews.text: My first visit to this concert hall. Very welcoming staff throughout. A spectacular auditorium with good acoustics; I heard the RLPO playing on their home turf. A nice bar area too. I sat at the back of the circle and I did find the legroom a bit cramped but that's a minor quibble.

Went to see How to Train your Dragon with live orchestra! Absolutely phenomenal experience. Incredibly talented people and very friendly staff. Entering with tickets on arrival was swift with no issues at all. Great venue for any show and would highly recommend to all to come and see a show here. Amazing night
Really nice venue. Here for Marvel Infinity Saga but have been here plenty of times over the years. Very good sound quality and a good range of different events throughout the year.

places.address: Philharmonic Hall, Hope St, Liverpool L1 9BP, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: The Walker Art Gallery is a Victorian museum that showcases significant art pieces from the 12th century onwards, featuring works by renowned artists such as Degas and Hockney. It is one of the must-visit attractions in Liverpool, offering a cultural experience for art enthusiasts. After exploring the gallery, visitors can immerse themselves in local culture, dine at excellent restaurants, and find budget-friendly accommodations nearby.

sources.snippet: This Valentine’s Day, you and the special person in your life could spend a few hours exploring the Walker Art Gallery and its fine collection of renaissance masterpieces, Tudor portraits and Victorian and Pre-Raphaelite art.  The gallery also has an outstanding display of contemporary art including work by David Hockney, Lucian Freud and Bridget Riley.
sources.shortName: 42 Romantic Things to Do This Valentine’s Day in Liverpool

sources.snippet: At the Walker Art Gallery, you can find a very large collection of art. Going to this gallery is one of the most romantic things to do in Liverpool. The art at this gallery varies a lot.
sources.shortName: 37 Romantic Things To Do in Liverpool: Date Ideas in Liverpool

places.name: Walker Art Gallery

reviews.text: A fantastic art gallery packed with interesting and avant garde art. It can rival any London art gallery. It was not crowded even though we visited it during half term. There was a lute player in the Elizabethan art room, which made it very atmospheric, and the children loved it. Don't miss it!

I really enjoyed the gallery, it had an amazing mix of paintings in different styles, like Impressionism and Post-Impressionism. The variety is impressive, and the best part? It's free to visit! Definitely worth checking out.

As an art and architecture enthusiast, the Walker Art Gallery quickly became one of my favourite spots in Liverpool. From the moment you step inside, you're greeted with a sense of grandeur-elegant halls, beautifully lit galleries, and a layout that allows each piece to breathe while still flowing seamlessly between periods and styles.

The permanent collection is impressive, ranging from classical works to Victorian masterpieces and striking contemporary pieces. It's a joy to wander through the different rooms, each revealing new textures, colours, and stories. I always find myself lingering a little longer than expected, drawn in by both familiar favourites and hidden gems.

What I also truly appreciate are the occasional exhibitions. They bring a fresh energy to the space and offer new perspectives, often highlighting themes or artists that complement the main collection beautifully. These temporary displays feel thoughtfully curated and make each return visit feel like a new experience.

The building itself is just as inspiring as the art it holds-a stunning example of classical architecture that elevates the entire experience. Whether you're an art lover or simply curious, the Walker Art Gallery is a must-visit. It's a place where creativity, history, and beauty come together effortlessly.

places.address: William Brown St, Liverpool, L3 8EL, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Sugar and Dice Board Game Café, located in the heart of Liverpool, offers a wide selection of over 400 board games for all ages and abilities. The café serves quality food and drinks, including delicious homemade treats like brownies. With classics such as Scrabble and Chess, as well as modern games like Adventure Time Card Wars and Exploding Kittens, there's something for everyone.

sources.snippet: For a laid-back but still equally competitive date, explore the delicious homemade treats and selection of board games on offer at Sugar and Dice!. Embrace some nostalgia and rediscover games from your childhood, and enjoy some time away from technology to really bond. With super friendly staff and a ‘Dogs Welcome!
sources.shortName: Date Ideas Liverpool: 23 Romantic Things to Do in Liverpool [2024]

sources.snippet: If you’re searching for relaxed date ideas in Liverpool then Sugar and Dice Board Game Cafè could be just right. With an extensive choice of board games and a menu of home-cooked food, drinks and cakes, this is the perfect setting to get to know each other or a great activity to share with friends.
sources.shortName: Date Ideas in Liverpool | Top 31 in 2025

sources.snippet: If you and your date are board game enthusiasts, head to Sugar and Dice, a bright and colourful café that is dedicated to games. From Monopoly and Scrabble, to Ker-Plunk, Jenga and Guess Who, they have literally hundreds of games to choose from.
sources.shortName: 42 Romantic Things to Do This Valentine’s Day in Liverpool

places.name: Sugar and Dice Board Game Café

reviews.text: Great board game cafe, located off the beaten track in a back road which had us apprehensive but it was such a hidden gem and we had a great time! We spent 2 hours (2.50 p/h) but could've happily spent longer. Great selection of games- we played 3 different ones, would recommend Mantis! Loud atmosphere but didn't really bother us, food was great if a little slow to come and the service was lovely, very friendly and helpful staff! They do cafe food (toasties, soup, nachos) and snack bowls (crisps, m&ms, popcorn) which we thought was a fab idea. Would recommend and would love to come back soon.

What an absolute spot! We stumbled across this place on our 4 days in Liverpool and spent hours here! Lovely and welcoming, plenty of snack and drink options! Such an incredible selection of board games, great option for those who don't drink and want something alternative to do. Was busy the whole time we were in there so clearly a well loved spot for the locals which is always a great sign!!

This cafe is a must go for all tabletop nerds coming to the area. With very friendly staff, delicious food and a wide range of games to play (as well as being welcome to bring your own, so long as you pay for the table) i can't compliment this place enough. Special thank you to Chris, who was working on the day i came, for making my visit as enjoyable as it was.

places.address: 33a Cornhill, Liverpool, L1 8DP, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Sefton Park Palm House is a stunning Victorian glasshouse located in Sefton Park, offering free admission to visitors every day. The Grade II* listed building features an elegant design that shines in the summer sun. Inside, the multi-million pound restored exotic palm house showcases vibrant vegetation in themed botanical displays, creating a tranquil escape from the city. The venue hosts various events throughout the year, including music and dance performances like the Free Sunday Concert.

sources.snippet: A stunning Victorian structure stands amid the of greenery at Sefton Park. The Palm House is among the most stunning historic structures still standing in the city. As evening descends upon the park the Palm House is bathed in moody uplighting providing the perfect backdrop for a romantic hand in hand stroll through the park.
sources.shortName: 10 Hidden Romantic Spots in and Around Liverpool

sources.snippet: Sefton Park Palmhouse is home to Liverpool’s botanical collection. Instead of buying your other half a bunch of flowers, why not present them with an entire house full!. There is a huge variety of flora and fauna to appreciate and it is entirely free.
sources.shortName: 5 romantic places to visit

places.name: Sefton Park Palm House

reviews.text: It's always a joy to shoot at Sefton Park Palm House - as a Liverpool wedding photographer it's one of my fave venues. A restored Victorian green house that's like an oasis in the city, full of tropical plants and history. I've shot winter, summer and autumnal weddings here - some of them were icy, some were rainy, some were sunny, but all of them were joyous and beautiful. The venue has a bar area, a relaxing seated area and a main hall for dining and dancing. It looks amazing when the sun streams in but also equally amazing when it's lit up at nighttime. The park around it offers some incredible backdrops for couple portraits, especially the mini forest of super tall evergreen trees, merely 2 minutes walk from the venue. Sunsets are always epic here, being able to see the sky turn pink from your dinner table is just gorgeous. As a supplier I've always been welcomed and fed well, which makes such a difference to my day. Can't wait to shoot there again!

We celebrated our wedding at the Palm House and we couldn't have picked a better venue. We'd visited multiple times before the big day but it was still completely magical to have our wedding there and feel the buzz of excitement from all of our guests seeing such a beautiful venue for the first time. We've had so many comments about how stunning the building was - we're glad it was a somewhat overcast day so it wasn't too hot inside! The team were also fantastic, from navigating complications over that weekend to being genuinely lovely people who were so excited for us, it really felt like the people were an important part of our day celebrating with us too. Thank you so much!

Fantastic to see this lovely historical old palm house restored and alive again. Compact in size, but amazing it's still here after it nearly was demolished because of years of neglect.
Tea room and ice-creams. Go visit, sit a while, and just enjoy!

places.address: Sefton Park, Liverpool, L17 1AP, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: The Maritime Museum offers a comprehensive look at maritime history across four floors. Visitors can explore Titanic displays, watch evocative films, and engage with hands-on exhibits. The museum provides an immersive experience that delves into the world of seafaring, making it a must-visit attraction for history enthusiasts and those interested in maritime culture.

sources.snippet: Get inspired at the Museum of Liverpool and visit the outstanding Double Fantasy, a ground-breaking exhibition telling John Lennon and Yoko Ono’s story in their own words. It explores the personal and creative chemistry of this iconic couple, making it the perfect Valentine’s Day date.
sources.shortName: 42 Romantic Things to Do This Valentine’s Day in Liverpool

sources.snippet: Indulge your inner Jack and Rose at the “Titanic and Liverpool: The Untold Story” permanent exhibition in the Maritime Museum, or witness man’s inhumanity to his fellow man at the hard-hitting International Slavery Museum.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Date Ideas in Liverpool

places.name: Maritime Museum

reviews.text:
The Maritime Museum in Liverpool is an absolute gem and a must-visit for history lovers. I've been a couple of times, and each visit has been as enjoyable as the last. The museum beautifully showcases Liverpool's rich maritime heritage, and the exhibits are both educational and deeply engaging.

The standout for me has always been the Titanic area. It's incredibly moving and thoughtfully presented, offering a powerful glimpse into the ship's history, its connection to Liverpool, and the human stories behind the tragedy. The artifacts and interactive displays really bring the history to life.

The museum's layout is easy to navigate, and the staff are always friendly and knowledgeable. Plus, admission is free, making it accessible for everyone. Whether it's your first time or a repeat visit, the Maritime Museum offers something special every time. Highly recommend!

We went to visit it but it was closed due to renovations. The area is nice, spacious and there's a lot of stores. I was told the museum has incredible exhibits and it's worth spending time there. There are toilets in every big block and lots of walking spaces.

I popped into the Maritime Museum in Liverpool, and honestly, it's a gem! Tucked away in the cool Albert Dock, it's got this vibe that pulls you right into the city's seafaring soul. You've got everything from old ship models to stories about the Titanic that hit you in the feels, plus a really moving section on the slave trade that doesn't shy away from the tough stuff. It's all super interactive, so you're not just staring at dusty relics. Best part? It's free (though I tossed in a donation). Perfect for a quick visit, maybe an hour or two, and you can swing by the Tate Liverpool after. Loved it-total must-see if you're into history or just curious!

places.address: Royal Albert Dock, Liverpool, L3 4AQ, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Game Over Escape Rooms Liverpool offers an exciting and challenging experience for groups looking to bond and have fun. With themed rooms like the haunted shipwreck, Maniac, Money Heist, and Squid games, participants will need to use logic, detective skills, and a bit of luck to escape. The theming is brilliant and the hosts are friendly and helpful, creating a memorable adventure for all who dare to enter.

sources.snippet: For a bigger group or double date, Escape Hunt on the Royal Albert Dock offers a range of Escape Room packages for a bit of competitive bonding. Take on a range of clues for a fun-filled afternoon that will immerse you in the challenge and get your heart racing. With games lasting around sixty minutes, this is the perfect event to add to your date day or for an exciting escape from reality if you don’t have a lot of time to spare!
sources.shortName: Date Ideas Liverpool: 23 Romantic Things to Do in Liverpool [2024]

sources.snippet: If both of you love to solve puzzles, then Escape Rooms offer you and your partner a classic and fun experience in Liverpool city.
sources.shortName: 15 Romantic Things To Do In Liverpool For A Charming Trip

places.name: Game Over Escape Rooms Liverpool

reviews.text: Great place, fun activity for all our kids has a ball in the Squid game escape room this morning! Thank you to our Game Host Helen too you were fantastic! We will see you again soon!

Great experience, we did the Pirates of the Caribbean game which was fun and some of the clues were a  bit different which made it more of a challenge! We got out with 5 minutes to spare, so the level of difficulty was just about right. Helen and Nicola were so friendly and made the experience really enjoyable. Looking forward to returning soon!

As a family of six, we just completed the Squid Games escape room, and it was absolutely amazing! We had so much fun, and I was really impressed to see all four kids working together. Nicola was fantastic-she guided us through the game and even threw in some extra surprises that made the experience even more exciting. We enjoyed it so much that we immediately booked another room for the day after. It's definitely worth a visit!

places.address: 68-76 Kempston St, Liverpool, L3 8HL, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Mersey Ferries offer a unique way to experience the Liverpool waterfront, serving as both a sightseeing attraction and commuter service. The River Explorer Cruise provides stunning views of the UNESCO world heritage skyline, while also offering insights into Liverpool's musical and maritime history. Passengers can enjoy the open deck on sunny days or opt for hot chocolates below deck during colder weather. The ferry terminals at Pier Head, Woodside, and Seacombe provide convenient embarkation points for this memorable experience.

sources.snippet: Follow in the 1964 footsteps of beat group Gerry and the Pacemakers, and hop aboard the Mersey ferry. Your proposal will have a backdrop of spectacular Liverpool Waterfront architecture including the iconic Three Graces, comprising the statuesque Royal Liver Building, Cunard Building and the Port of Liverpool Building – all constructed in the early 20th century when the city was at the height of its maritime and trading power. The sleek shape of the fascinating Museum of Liverpool is another waterfront landmark, along with the exquisitely restored Royal Albert Dock, spindly Radio City Tower and the granite Titanic Memorial Liverpool among many others.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Date Ideas in Liverpool

sources.snippet: There are lots of tours to check out, from the Liverpool e-bike tour to go on a romantic ferry tour for two with your spouse on the Liverpool’s beautiful waterways. Book a private tour and view the lovely city and see the interesting sites from a fancy decorated ferry cruiser. While on the ferry, your tour guide will help you grab a full gis of the interesting site.
sources.shortName: Fun & Romantic Things To Do In Liverpool For Couples - ItsAllBee

sources.snippet: Enjoy the scenic backdrop of Liverpool by taking a trip along the Mersey Ferry before asking that special someone marry you?. Mersey Ferries offer both daytime and evening ferries, which offer a waterside view of the city. If you do decide to propose in the evening, Mersey Ferries do special events with a range of live music being offered by DJs and tribute bands.
sources.shortName: Five Most Romantic Proposal Spots in Liverpool from

sources.snippet: With the city of Liverpool as your backdrop, take yourself away from bustling crowds and propose to the sound of the sea. For something with a bit of a twist, check out some of the Ferries evening cruises, to enjoy with a glass of fizz and live music!. Be sure to check the ferry schedules for the perfect time for your 'marry me' moment.
sources.shortName: Romantic Places To Propose In Liverpool

sources.snippet: We’re all about the setting when it comes to your memorable moment, and with the city standing tall and graceful behind you, why not choose a Mersey Ferry cruise to propose?. You might even get to honk the Ferry horn in celebration!. Ferry schedules here.
sources.shortName: These are the top places to propose in Liverpool in 2019

sources.snippet: The Mersey Ferry is one of Liverpool’s oldest and most iconic modes of transport. Graced by famous faces over the years including the Queen and the Beatles, it’s the ideal place to take in the breathtaking waterfront as you bob along.
sources.shortName: 42 Romantic Things to Do This Valentine’s Day in Liverpool
10 Fun Things to Do in Liverpool for Couples in 2024

places.name: Mersey Ferries

reviews.text: We just had to take the Ferry Across The Mersey on our Liverpool trip. Easy access. Lots of  guidance. Plenty of places to sit if that's your choice. Great commentary explaining places buildings etc in great detail throughout whole trip. Fascinating. Peppered with a couple of lines of Gerry and The Pacemakers iconic song. We thoroughly enjoyed it - our first activity of our trip. Enjoy yours.

We took the 50 minute river cruise and really enjoyed the cruise and the comentary.  It was a great was to learn about the city and its history.  We booked the cruise direct, and bought our tickets an hour or so before hand.  We arrived 15 minutes before the cruise time and there was already a huge queue for boarding.  Their turn around time between cruises is quick.  We originally got seats upstairs - which was great - but it was a hot day and the sun was intense, so we moved downstairs in the shade for the second half.  Would definitely recommend this, especially for a first time visitor to Liverpool.

a nice area and pretty straight forward to navigate yourself through, luckily we picked out a sunny day but i cannot see this being a great thing if its a cold windy day or raining, the outside decks were kept clean and safe, although does get windy, the tour was nice and pleasant but when the woman over the microphone was explaining the story behind all the monuments, it was difficult to understand what she was referring to. Overall a nice experience and would recommend. Lasts about 45 minutes.

places.address: Pier Head, George Parade, Liverpool L3 1DP, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Aintree Racecourse, located in the north of Liverpool, is renowned for hosting the historic and demanding Grand National steeplechase since 1839. This three-day event attracts a global audience of over 600 million people annually. In addition to the Grand National, Aintree hosts six other racing days featuring family entertainment, Christmas celebrations, and acoustic nights. The racecourse holds numerous records for horse racing bets and individual horses.

sources.snippet: We hear on the grapevine that the team at The Jockey Club at Aintree Racecourse are a soppy bunch too and love a good personalised message on the big screens. Why not back a winner and get your proposal on the course or the days race card?
sources.shortName: These are the top places to propose in Liverpool in 2019

sources.snippet: You could always dress up in your finery and try your luck at the races at Aintree Racecourse. Home to The Grand National, Aintree also features other race meetings through the year. The Grand National at Aintree © The Jockey Club
sources.shortName: Romantic Things To Do In Liverpool on AboutBritain.com

sources.snippet: If you and your partner like sports, you can go to the Aintree Racecourse. You find this racecourse a bit outside of the city. Many sports races take place here.
sources.shortName: 37 Romantic Things To Do in Liverpool: Date Ideas in Liverpool

places.name: Aintree Racecourse

reviews.text:
Another fantastic day at the races the weather was amazing and the ppl were great.
We booked the steeple chase car park and it was fine.
Everyone seemed to be having a good time.
Its a must to visit on the day.
Book early though because the tickets go fast.
It was well signed posted, a bit hectic trying to get out though.
The traffic marshals weren't up to scratch they seemed that they didn't have a clue how to divert the traffic.
The drinks were a bit steep but that's the races for you .
The only downside was the injury to the horse in the national. Good side was the winner in the national.

Regarding the Grand National Tour:

I booked a place on the Grand National - Behind The Scenes Tour with Jane Clarke, on my own, as a huge fan of the race. What a day! Jane was absolutely fantastic, knew tiny little details and interesting facts. We explored the course, into McCoys, Stands, the Parade Ring, the Weighing Rooms, across to Red Rum's grave and a close up walk to the water jump. There was so much memorabilia (silks, trophies, tack). The tour overran by over an hour but that's because the group didn't want it to be over!  Jane has all the time in the world for us. I would happily book this again in a heartbeat. We could take as many photos as we wanted.

Tiny disappointment that we wasn't allowed access to the stables on this date as there was a dressage competition, understandable but still a tiny disappointment out of Jane's control. She did try but the stable manager refused access due to horses coming and going to the equestrian centre.

Highly recommend to anyone with an interest!

Went for Fridays meeting, very busy but found a good place to stand in after the finish line. Good access to pre parade and parade rings.
Enjoyable day but usual issues with food and drink being extremely expensive.

places.address: Ormskirk Rd, Aintree, Liverpool L9 5AS, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Breakout Liverpool, located on Sir Thomas Street, has gained popularity as a must-visit destination for those seeking an entertaining experience in the city. This live escape room game challenges groups of friends, family, or colleagues to solve puzzles and unravel mysteries within a one-hour time limit. With various rooms of different difficulties, it caters to individuals with varying levels of intelligence and offers great value for an enjoyable experience.

sources.snippet: Looking for interactive date ideas in Liverpool that challenge your thinking and your team working skills?. Then look no further than Breakout. This live escape room challenge gives you just 60 minutes to solve the clues and find a way out.
sources.shortName: Date Ideas in Liverpool | Top 31 in 2025

sources.snippet: Both have a variety of uniquely themed rooms to play, from Jack The Ripper to Jail Break. This is especially fun as a first date to break the ice if you’re looking for date ideas Liverpool wise.
sources.shortName: Things To Do In Liverpool For Couples

sources.snippet: With loads of different rooms to choose from, each with a different intriguing theme, it’s all about team work and code cracking with this one. See if you can Breakout together!

places.name: Breakout Liverpool

reviews.text: Absolutely brilliant experience.  DJ greeted us and looked after us brilliantly throughout our experience.  We did the Wanted room, and it was excellent. Clear instructions beforehand, and we even got to dress up in Cowboy Hats and Bandanna, which added to the experience. The room was challenging but not so difficult that we couldn't solve the clues. DJ was on hand to help us at the crucial times, which really added to the overall experience.  He did this via cameras in the room, so his timing was always bang on (pardon the pun). I would definitely recommend a visit. We are keen to go back and try another room!

Had such a great experience! My partner and I did the Outbreak zombie themed room. It was amazing and super immersive. Lots of aspects to it, a lot of problem solving involved, and some puzzles I have never come across in my life. I have visited multiple escape rooms across the country and this one was great to say the least! Sean was our host and is such a lovely guy. He explained everything perfectly and took our photo at the end. We had the chance to even take a Polaroid photo home with us for memories!
Thank you Breakout Liverpool!!

We enjoyed Breakout Liverpool so much, we went twice during our stay-and both visits were fantastic!

On our first visit, we did the Outbreak room with Alex as our game master. The room was complex, engaging, and full of clever puzzles. Alex was brilliant-offering hints at just the right moments (not that we needed many!). We escaped with just 25 seconds to spare-no zombies got us this time!

We were so impressed that we came back a second time and did Facility, with Jess as our game master. Just like Alex, Jess was amazing-super friendly, helpful, and clearly passionate about the experience. This room was a bit tougher than the first, and we're grateful Jess gave us a little extra time to get through it!

We'll definitely be back next time we're in Liverpool to try out the rest of the rooms-hopefully with Alex or Jess guiding us again. Highly recommend!

places.address: 7-11 Sir Thomas St, Liverpool, L1 6BW, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Embark on the enchanting Magical Mystery Tour in Liverpool, a delightful two-hour journey that immerses you in the rich history of The Beatles. Hosted by the iconic Cavern Club, this vibrant bus tour whisks you away to significant locations tied to John, Paul, George, and Ringo. Starting at Royal Albert Dock, you'll visit their childhood homes and schools while soaking up the atmosphere of places like Penny Lane and Strawberry Fields—each a source of inspiration for their timeless songs.

sources.snippet: Take a Boat tour on the Mersey River, Take the Magical Mystery Tour, Watch a film at Everyman Cinema, Walkthrough Sefton Park, and many more.
sources.shortName: 15 Romantic Things To Do In Liverpool For A Charming Trip
42 Romantic Things to Do This Valentine’s Day in Liverpool

places.name: Magical Mystery Tour Liverpool

reviews.text:
The Beatles Magical Mystery Tour is an absolute must for any Beatles fan visiting Liverpool. This vibrant and entertaining guided bus tour takes you on a journey through the band's incredible history, visiting iconic locations that played a key role in their lives and careers.

The tour departs from the Albert Dock and immediately sets a fun tone with the colorful, psychedelic bus that mirrors the artwork from the famous Magical Mystery Tour album. The moment you hop on, the Beatles soundtrack begins, and you're immersed in their music and legacy.

Over the course of around two hours, the tour covers key locations such as Penny Lane, Strawberry Field, the childhood homes of John, Paul, George, and Ringo, as well as places referenced in their lyrics. The guide on our tour was knowledgeable, engaging, and added plenty of fun trivia and personal stories that made the experience feel unique and lively.

The pace was comfortable, with short stops to step out and take photos at major spots. One highlight was stopping at Penny Lane, where everyone took turns posing by the street sign while “Penny Lane” played on the speakers - a magical moment for fans.

The tour concludes at the legendary Cavern Club, where visitors can enjoy live music and soak in even more Beatles atmosphere. Entry is included in the ticket, which is a great bonus.

The entire experience was well-organized and offered a great balance of music, storytelling, and sightseeing. Whether you're a lifelong Beatles fan or just curious about Liverpool's cultural heritage, this tour offers a nostalgic, informative, and very enjoyable ride.

Highly recommended for anyone wanting to walk - or ride - in the footsteps of the Fab Four!

We enjoyed everything about this tour. All the Beatles' music and info was fun and nonstop. Dale and  our driver were phenomenal.  They kept us engaged and laughing. You'll be able to pop on and off the bus to see several points of interest. You'll have time take some pics too. As part of the tour you get a pass into The Cavern.  We heard some good music there.  If you're in Liverpool, you can't skip it. Whether you're a huge Beatles fan or not, this tour is terrific.

We had an absolutely fantastic time on the Magical Mystery Tour in Liverpool! Our guide, Neil, was incredibly knowledgeable and entertaining – he brought the Beatles' story to life with brilliant energy and humour. Dennis, our driver, was also fantastic – navigating the city smoothly while the Beatles' tunes played in the background, creating the perfect atmosphere.

We learned so many interesting and lesser-known facts about the Fab Four and their lives growing up in Liverpool. The stops were well-planned, and it was amazing to see the real-life places behind the lyrics and legacy.

Highly recommend this tour to any Beatles fan or anyone interested in Liverpool's musical history. A truly magical experience – thank you, Neil and Dennis!

places.address: Anchor Courtyard, 32 Gower St, Liverpool L3 4AS, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Ascend to the top of St Johns Beacon, also known as the Radio City Tower, and treat yourself to stunning panoramic views of Liverpool and its surroundings. Standing at 138 meters tall, this iconic landmark offers a 360-degree viewing gallery that showcases the beauty of Merseyside, Wirral, North Wales, and even Lancashire on clear days. From this vantage point, you can marvel at famous landmarks and cityscapes while gaining a new perspective on the region's geography.

sources.snippet: St. John's Beacon is an observation tower from where you can get a beautiful view of the city. Going there is one of the most romantic things to do in Liverpool. The tower is 453 feet (or 138 meters) tall, which means that your view will be amazing!
sources.shortName: 37 Romantic Things To Do in Liverpool: Date Ideas in Liverpool
15 Romantic Things To Do In Liverpool For A Charming Trip

places.name: St Johns Beacon

reviews.text: Wonderful bird's eye view of Liverpool. You can stay as long as you want. The staff are very friendly. It has a wonderful gallery telling the history of notable landmarks of Liverpool. If you are in Liverpool, visit this place first. You will have an 101 course on Liverpool history - and then you will have a clear idea which places you must visit.

An iconic landmark in the heart of Liverpool!
Great view of the city and beyond from the top perfect for photos. Even just seeing it up close is a cool experience. A must-visit if you're in town.

#Liverpool #RadioCityTower #CityViews

This is an absolute must-visit in Liverpool, especially if you're a fan of breathtaking views! From the top, you get a stunning panorama of the entire city, including the bustling port and all the major landmarks. It's truly the best way to appreciate Liverpool's unique landscape.

The staff were generally friendly and helpful, though I did have a slightly odd encounter with the entrance attendant who wasn't exactly welcoming. However, that small hiccup didn't detract from the overall amazing experience.

I highly recommend this place to anyone visiting Liverpool. It's definitely worth checking out!

places.address: 1 Houghton St, Liverpool, L1 1RL, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Crosby Beach, located just half an hour north of central Liverpool, offers a captivating experience for visitors. The beach is adorned with a striking installation called Another Place by renowned sculptor Antony Gormley, featuring 100 life-size figures spread across two miles of the coastline. These iron casts of the artist's body create a mesmerizing sight against the backdrop of the sea and sky, constantly changing with the tides and weather.

sources.snippet: One of the most bewitching spots for a picnic on a sunny day or a brisk winter walk à deux is to be found on Crosby Beach, half an hour north of central Liverpool. This once-deserted stretch of sand is now home to a 100-strong series of life-size figures called “Another Place” by sculptor Antony Gormley, who created the fabled “Angel of the North” in 1998. The entrancing, moss-covered installations – made from iron casts of his own body – stand bleak against the sea and sky, scattered over two miles (3.2 km), morphing in mood with the weather, and slowly submerging and reappearing according to the ebb or flow of the tide.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Date Ideas in Liverpool

sources.snippet: Noted as one of the UK’s to top 10 beaches, Crosby Beach is the ideal romantic escape away from the Liverpool’s bustling city centre. The stretch of soft white sand is reminiscent of far-flung coastal destinations such as the Bahamas or the Maldives. Take a romantic stroll alongside the breaking waves and take a look at unique art installation ‘Another Place’ by Anthony Gormley.

sources.snippet: With holidays abroad being more accessible through last-minute online deals, it’s easy to forget that the UK hosts some stunning beaches and coastlines. Crosby Beach is no exception, being awarded the Quality Coast Award by Keep Britain Tidy, it makes the perfect secluded and peaceful spot for a romantic picnic or to ask your loved one to marry you.

places.generalDescription: The Otterspool Promenade is a beloved riverside walk along the Mersey River, offering a serene escape from city life. It's popular for kite flying, biking, and dog walking, with a playground and skate park for added enjoyment. The promenade provides stunning views of the river and Liverpool's cityscape. Visitors can spot seals and porpoises in the water while strolling towards the picturesque Festival Gardens.

sources.snippet: If you are looking for a quiet spot to spend some quality time together, why not cycle on up to Otterspool and watch the sun go down. The clear, unbroken views over the River Mersey from this green oasis are sure to melt the heart of even the most cynical Valentine.

places.name: The Otterspool Promenade

reviews.text:
Got to love the Prom.
I have been coming to Otterspool for 60+ years - with my parents and grandparents as a kid.
I still come down here on special days to remember them.
It is a vibrant place with lot's of room.
We only lived a few miles away but I remember my Dad saying "If you had driven a couple of hours and found a place like this you'd be made up"
Lovely place to spend an hour or an afternoon. Walk straight to town or lie on a lounger and enjoy watching the river. Loads of open space for kids and room for a picnic.

Visited here today in the camper van . Lovely parking spot by the water . We took a ride along doing 11 miles or there abouts . Lovely place , views not bad at all. Not busy which is lovely especially on a bank holiday.
Great parking and clean place 👌

places.generalDescription: Perched 300 meters above the city of Liverpool, Panoramic 34 is a restaurant and cocktail lounge offering breathtaking panoramic views. The elegant establishment features floor-to-ceiling windows that showcase the stunning cityscape while providing excellent service and beautifully-designed interiors. Guests can indulge in European cuisine, including Cornish roasted monkfish, as well as options like a tasting menu, afternoon tea, and lunch.

sources.snippet: Panoramic 34 is a restaurant and cocktail lounge that definitely lives up to its name, with diners able to enjoy outstanding views over the city of Liverpool from a height of 980 feet (300 metres). The establishment boasts floor-to-ceiling windows, which ensure the full majesty of the view can be seen, along with excellent service and beautifully-designed internal surroundings. In addition to admiring the view, you and your date will be able to sample the fantastic fine dining experience, which includes options such as a tasting menu, afternoon tea, and lunch.

sources.snippet: Offering panoramic views of the city, the fittingly named Panoramic 34 is a romantic restaurant that's sure to blow your partner away. Experience a night of luxury, drinking cool cocktails like a Liverpool sour or a gin and Aperol-based East 48 Hold Up, with breathtaking sights and plenty of Insta-moments.

places.name: Panoramic 34

reviews.text:
The afternoon tea at Panoramic 34 was an absolute treat! From the moment we arrived, the service was impeccable - attentive and friendly without being intrusive. And those views! Wow, they truly live up to the name. Sipping tea and nibbling on delicious sandwiches and cakes with the whole of Liverpool spread out beneath you is an experience you won't soon forget.
The food itself was delightful. The sandwiches were fresh and flavorful, and the selection of cakes and pastries was both beautiful and tasty. The scones were warm and crumbly, just as they should be, and the accompanying jam and clotted cream were perfect.

Went here yesterday and the view of one the most beautiful iconic skylines was clearly visible from the restaurant, had managed to obtain a window view,which I was very happy about. Excellent service, staff were very pleasant and helpful. As a surprise to even me, after paying the bill they brought out a plate with two chocolates with Happy Anniversary. Really enjoyed the dessert and cocktails. Definitely recommend this place. Sat in the cocktail lounge

Went with my wife for our 20th wedding anniversary (lunch)
Given  a table without  much of a view but tables  facing liverpool  skyline  were free.(the best views)
This did quite annoy me as nobody took these tables  for our duration. ..
I really think they couldn't  be bothered  relaying these  tables.
Service was OK, nothing  special, food was also OK, obviously portions are quite small.
Prices are on the higher  side , paid around £160 for set menu with bottle of wine.
Been here around 3 times previously and always enjoyed it as its views are spectacular.
Would  still recommend as a one off experience, but this could  be so much better.
Gone a bit stale in my opinion and taking  people  for granted.

places.address: West Tower, Brook St, Liverpool L3 9PJ, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Embark on a captivating journey through Liverpool's iconic Royal Liver Building with the Royal Liver Building 360 Tour. Ascend to the 10th and 15th floors for breathtaking panoramic views of the city and Wirral, capturing stunning photo opportunities. Delve into an immersive audio-visual experience inside the clocktower and marvel at one of its famous clock faces up close. This family-friendly tour offers a unique perspective on this historic landmark, making it a must-see attraction in Liverpool.

sources.snippet: Royal Liver Building 360 is a unique tower experience that invites guests to view the city and Wirral from the 10th and 15th floors of this iconic landmark. Will you be the first to propose there?. The online booking system goes live this month.
sources.shortName: These are the top places to propose in Liverpool in 2019

sources.snippet: This awesome building is the best place for your first day in Liverpool. It was completed in 1911. And it was one of the tallest buildings in the world.You will see it sitting on top of the building clearly.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things To Do In Liverpool For Couples (+3 Days Itinerary)
48 hours in Liverpool - a romantic city break

places.name: Royal Liver Building 360 Tour

reviews.text:
Amazing Experience at Royal Liver Building 360!
We had an incredible time on the Royal Liver Building 360 Tour! The experience was both educational and breathtaking, offering stunning panoramic views of Liverpool from the top of this iconic landmark.

Our guide was absolutely fantastic-she was not only knowledgeable but also incredibly friendly and engaging. Her passion for the history of the building and the city was evident, and she made the tour even more enjoyable with her insightful stories and warm personality. It was clear she had a deep understanding of Liverpool's heritage, and her enthusiasm was contagious!

The multimedia exhibition and the clock tower visit were definite highlights, giving a unique perspective on this historic site. I highly recommend this tour to anyone visiting Liverpool-whether you're a local or a tourist, it's a must-see!

Fabulous visit to Liver Building and roof top tour. Firstly the entrance is down steps at right side of the front of the building. Secondly the 124 steps climb are not a problem, you stop twice on the way up and one time for a 10 min audio/visual, so all good if you worry about the climb.
Lastly, before we get to views, the tour guides are great and add so much to the experience, with knowledge and passion about building and Liverpool!
The main event of the views from both levels didn't disappoint! I would recommend a nice sunny day with little wind for a visit, but good luck with that with the British weather being what it is!
Overall well worth a visit

Took the tour which lasts about 70 minutes with Molly as our guide. She was very informative about the history of the  building and answered all our questions. The tour starts down steps on Water Street and then a small lift up to floor 10. Great views of the city and port especially as it was a sunny day. There is a short video half way to the top and then winding stairs to get to the highest part of the tour.  A couple of the steps are steep as well. More great views from the upper 360° terrace. Plenty of time to take photographs before heading back down . The stairs aren't as strenuous as it sounds with over 100 to climb and you do get a rest half way up for the video.

places.address: Pier Head, Liverpool, L3 1HU, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Leaf on Bold Street is a charming split-level cafe bar in Liverpool, housed in an old cinema building. It's renowned for serving one of the best breakfasts in the city, offering a diverse range of options including full English breakfast, vegan and veggie choices, and unique dishes like smoked haddock and dill fish cake. The cafe also boasts an extensive selection of specialty teas from around the world, with over 60 rare loose leaf varieties available.

sources.snippet: A meal or afternoon tea at Leaf is guaranteed to be a memorable occasion, as they are the tea specialists, and Leaf is much more than a cafe!. Their motto is "tea, music and good times!". It is situated in a beautiful art deco building on Bold Street, and serves wholesome food, over 100 varieties of tea, and holds regular music and club nights.

sources.snippet: If you’d prefer something a bit less formal, make your way to the Baltic Market and check out some of the live acts they play host to, or enjoy some open mic at The Jacaranda, Hannah’s Bar, The Brink or Leaf.

sources.snippet: They have a fantastic breakfast menu so whether you're after a full English or fancy a shakshuka this is the place to go.

places.name: Leaf

reviews.text:
Booked in here for first date day meal following the birth of our son, having done the same after our daughter was born a few years back.

Apart from the wait to be seated when there were a large number of empty tables ready to be used the service was good. Once seated drinks and food orders taken quickly. Coffees arrived very quickly and food shortly after. Neither disappoint and make up for the wait at the start.

One salt and pepper chicken burger and one steak baguette went down a treat. Would recommend.

Repeat customer and will be returning again!

We came for brunch. It was quite busy at the time, but there were plenty of seats available, including upstairs, so we were quickly seated. The service was warm and friendly. I really liked the rustic-themed interior design, and the background music was pleasant to listen to.
There was a wide variety of menu options, with different brunch and lunch selections. We ordered dishes we had never tried before - sweet items served in a savoury style - and they use halal chicken. We didn't have to wait long for our food. The presentation was appealing, and the dishes were very flavourful.
I noticed an Asian touch in the bread and butter pudding I had. I really enjoyed it at first, though by the end the portion felt a bit too much for me to finish alone.
The main reason I chose this restaurant was because they offer matcha latte on the menu, but unfortunately I didn't find the matcha flavour particularly strong or distinctive.
The service was fast and efficient. It's no surprise they have many loyal customers.

I have never been to an establishment where all of the waiting staff were impersonal, borderline rude.

The waitress could not be bothered (being polite) to divide the bill to our request.

The presentation and the portion size of the food we were all served was of low standard with zero presentation.

The toilets stunk of heavy urine like one would smell on a dual carriageway lay by.

This establishment is definitely not value for money or service.

There is also 7.5% automatic service charge!
There are plenty more establishment's nearby whom would appreciate your custom.

Would not recommend.

places.address: 65-67 Bold St, Liverpool, L1 4EZ, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: The Art School Restaurant is a sophisticated dining establishment located in Liverpool's Georgian Quarter. The restaurant offers fine-dining menus featuring locally sourced produce served in a light-filled room with a large skylight. Chef patron Paul Askew curates special events like the Mother's Day Celebration, offering a glass of Aienera Methode de Champenoise to toast to mom on arrival and an exquisite three-course menu.

sources.snippet: Another fine-dining option, The Art School Restaurant offers up-scale, fine-dining meals, made with locally sourced produce that’s partnered with an extensive wine list. The large, light-filled dining room makes it perfect for a daytime lunch date, or, by night, the ceiling is lit with twinkling lights. Book early to avoid disappointment, and be prepared to splash out a little!
sources.shortName: 15 Fun Things To Do in Liverpool for Couples

sources.snippet: Serving a mouthwatering menu featuring a sharing charcuterie platter, it's no wonder why this is one of the best places for a romantic meal in Liverpool. Located on Sugnall Street, The Art School Restaurant has a fantastic range of British food that can be enjoyed in their stunning private dining room.
sources.shortName: Over 20 Things To Do For Couples In Liverpool

sources.shortName: Things To Do In Liverpool For Couples

sources.snippet: The Art School restaurant is guaranteed to impress your date. It is owned by Paul Askew, the famous North West food champion. The dishes include many options which you can recreate yourself from his debut book Onwards and Upwards.
sources.shortName: Romantic Places to Spend an Evening in Liverpool – CARO lets
19 super-romantic restaurants for a Valentine's date in Liverpool

places.name: The Art School Restaurant

reviews.text: We were a party of 6, celebrating an 80th birthday. Our menus had been printed with Happy 80th Birthday on them and a little birthday treat at the end of the meal, which was a lovely touch. We did the tasting menu and wine pairing. The food was outstanding, and the wines were a perfect match. We have dined in many places doing tasting menus, and The Art School has by far been the best. The staff were all very attentive and friendly. We wouldn't hesitate to return and we would highly recommend this gorgeous restaurant.

I'm lucky to say I've Lost count of how many visits we've made to this very special place. Every single time we visit EVERYTHING is 10/10. The food is divine and the staff make each visit so wonderful and memorable for us and it makes us want to visit time and time again. There is no other place in this city that will ever beat the dining experience of the art school. The food is not only delicious but each plate is a work of art lovingly made and delivered by some incredibly talented and friendly staff, it was lovely to see some familiar faces and had the pleasure of meeting some of the new members of the team last night, all who made our visit wonderful once again, thank you for a lovely time, as always ❤️
The testing menu was really delicious. Each plate was well presented. The atmosphere is elegant and the staff members were really approachable and friendly 🤩

places.address: 1 Sugnall St, Liverpool, L7 7EB, United Kingdom
